page.title: 16ASCOT RAILWAY STATION
page.content: The railway station is over 100 years old. There are about 8 men employed here and the Station Master is called Mr. Chapman. There are 5 tracks but only 4 are used at this present time.The tracks are 4 foot 8 inches wide and carry direct current to run the trains. At the moment work is taking place to modernise the station and will last about 35 weeks.When this is complete there will be a new kiosk,a small canopy and a disabled toilet. Trains leave this station for Reading, London and Guildford. During Royal Ascot Week about 40 to 50 thousand people pass through. In a normal week about 7 thousand people use the station.
